contents: Oscar Wilde once said, “Education is an admirable thing... but nothing worth knowing can ever be  taught.” There’s more value in real-world experience than there is sitting in a classroom. (17) <u>Wilde was right.</u> I’ve learned a lot from working in a restaurant. I plan to run my own restaurant one day. (18) <u>I learned math by figuring out checks and calculating tax. I learned communication skills by conversing with customers and co-workers.</u> If I couldn’t do that, I wouldn’t get a bad grade; I’d lose my job. (19) <u>I’ve had to persuade them to buy our specials or our higher-priced items.</u> Plus I’ve worked with people from all different backgrounds and with very different personalities. (20) <u>Learning words from different languages, these people have taught me about their cultures.</u> The restaurant business is the best education you can get. (21) <u>In fact, it’s even better than a free education, because you get paid!</u>
